alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued October 03 at 5:13PM MST until October 03 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MST FOR MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES... At 513 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Blackwater to 10 miles southwest of Maricopa to near Freeman to near Gila Bend Auxiliary Field, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 164 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 92 and 178. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 124 and 163. Locations impacted include... Chandler, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, Casa Grande, Coolidge, Gila Bend, Sun Lakes, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Estrella, Arizona City, La Palma, Big Horn and Cotton Center. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, then pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
